alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 23 at 4:21PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...LONG DURATION PRECIPITATION EVENT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... A series of surface fronts will impact parts of Southcentral throughout the next few days. The precipitation begins along the eastern Kenai Peninsula this afternoon and will spread northeastward to western Prince William Sound later today. Precipitation is expected to be mostly rain along the coasts, and it will be heaviest from tonight through Friday. Rain will start to gradually taper off Saturday morning from south to north along the coast. Whittier will see the highest rain amounts of 6 to 10 inches possible, and Seward will likely see around 2 to 4 inches. Rain combined with melting snow may create standing water on roadways where poor drainage exists, particularly near Turnagain Pass. Motorists are urged to use caution while traveling.
